column1: '''1965 BBC Interview''' is a [[Index:Audio recordings of J.R.R. Tolkien|recorded]] [[Index:Interviews with J.R.R. Tolkien|interview]] with [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] on [[20 January|January 20]]
column3: to be placed in the BBC's Recorded Programmes Permanent Library.<ref>''[[The J.R.R. Tolkien Companion and Guide]]: Chronology''
column6: says the interview was recorded for the BBC Sound Archive and was not transmitted.''</ref>. The interview comprises a detailed discussion about ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]'' and  whether Tolkien will be remembered for his fiction or his academic career.<ref>Publishers' note to the ''[[The Spoken Word: British Writers]]''.</ref>

column1: *Publication: An extract was released on ''[[The Spoken Word: British Writers]]''. Another extract
column2: where Tolkien discusses the grammar of the word 'Dwarves'
column3: was published in ''[[The Annotated Hobbit: Revised and Expanded Edition]]''

column1: As a trial for this interview
column2: [[Denys Gueroult]] had already made an informal recording of Tolkien in 1964 (see ''[[1964 BBC Interview]]'').
